WRITING.TEXT: Yeah and they do cardio at the gym too so 3x gym a day :P But yeah, the amount wasn't really the main point here as much as why they're able to work SO much more than a regular guy. Got it answered pretty much though!

Possibly, but I seriously doubt it. I'm extremely open minded though, so if someone proves me wrong I'll just change my views, at the moment there just happen to be a lot of evidence claiming the opposite of what you're claiming.

Okay, I respect your opinion =). Not here to argue, here to learn, I simply choose to trust the articles and studies I've read over you, sorry, I do still appreciate the input you've had even if it's been a bit negative
Well you can obviously make gains even if you're working too much, you just won't make as big gains. Kinda like with cheat reps etc. obviously it's still somewhat beneficial, just not as

Holy fuck, 10x10 twice a week sounds super rough already though D: How much were you able to add to that. Upping training from that by 'shitload' sounds fucking insane. Guess I really did not know how much steroids in reality enhance you

Ohh, that explains, so they're just doing what everyone else does but with A LOT bigger volume
(for example cardio stretching etc.) and it just gets to such volumes that they actually have to take breaks because it would take too long. Thanks!
Yeah, figured. Guess I've just never really understood how big the difference can be between a guy who's really fit and a guy who's competing at the highest possible level
Then how do they work out? Judging from my post it's pretty clear I'm trying to understand stuff here lol
oh right, genetics has to be a big part too, forgot that aswel :/ Glad this question is being thoroughly answered though! A lot of good info

Not gonna argue against you, if you wanna think overtraining doesn't exist. Do so, you can find a lot better and more information online than I could ever be able to provide you with.
Also, maybe not always 48 hours, that's the average from what I've heard and read. For example work capacity, didn't remember that thing even exists
Yeah but if they spend 1-3 hours in gym for each time they work out, that's like 3-9 hours of gym per day, don't they run out of muscles to train lol?
Oh, this actually makes sense! Thanks, kinda forgot about work capacity here :/ Makes even more sense why being a bodybuilder for a long time is beneficial now
Never said the same muscle, I just asked how it's possible :P
What do you mean inaccurate? Your muscles need time to recover, that's a fact :/? And is it really possible that the drugs allow the to exceed the limits by this much? That's the part I'm not getting
Well yeah and I understand that you practice a lot if you're playing a sport that allows you to, but I've always heard that the physical limits are there, even if you're juicing.
Oh, so they don't go that hard then? But is that better than going insanely hard with as big of a volume as possible once per day?

WRITING.TITLE: Problem trying to install a program.
WRITING.TEXT: I'm using 64 bit windows 8.1. First of all I want to say that I've spent approx 5 hours trying out different answers from google, and they have not worked. This post might also be a long one since there's a bit back story included(not yet, if needed I'll add), but if you think it might not be necessary feel free to skip it. Thanks in advance. Okay so I'm trying to download drivers to my wacom intuos pen-tablet. I have no problem downloading it, but when I try to run it it all goes well except that 2 times during the installation after running the exe file that's meant to install the drivers I get the 0xc000007b error, so basically ''program was unable to run properly''. I've never had this problem before, I've been using this tablet and the drivers for almost a year now and everything has worked, but now after having to factory reset my pc (This is where the backstory jumps in, if the reason matters I can tell it but it's a bit complicated) and trying to reinstall it something just goes wrong. I've tried every possible solution I've found, most of which just tell me to download a file that redownloads and installs windows programs and drivers in case some of them isn't working. The videos or forums that have had this linked have also had huge amount of ''thanks it helped'' comments, so I'd guess this is what works for most people. Not for me though. uninstalling the program and deleting every file about it that it had in the folder, I also searched up for more and found two more .exe files that were also part of it but didn't get removed during the uninstall. tl;dr Wacom intuos driver installation doesn't work. Gives a common error (0xc000007b) but none of the solutions I've found during 4-5 hours have worked.

WRITING.TITLE: Why am I not ranking up?
WRITING.TEXT:
Yeah so a little backstory first. I used to be supreme/global back in the day (like 2 years ago) and quit the game due to various reasons. Kept playing one game every now and then and got placed to lower and lower rank, until finally starting the game again after getting placed to gn2 (wasn't waiting until that happened just got motivation to play again)
Now that the prime matchmaking exists and I've gotten some of my aim back it's fairly easy to win games for me, and I've ranked up to mg1 in few days, my question is, how many games does it usually take to rank up? At the moment I'm on a ~25 win streak and that has only gotten me 2 ranks from gn3 (lost a few and won a few before getting to gn3 while getting my aim and skills back), while playing against higher ranks than me? I'm also top fragging in every game (probably have been 3rd or 2nd like 3 times out of those ~25 games).
I remember that it used to take me like 5 wins in a row to rank up when I was gold nova or mg1 for the first time, not 13 or so? Took me 15 to get to lem for the first time, what's up with this? Is it normal nowadays or is there something I'm not aware of?
Thanks for any responses. Greatly appreciated.
Ps. Also I feel the need to say, that I'm not really complaining, just wondering because from what I remember this isn't normal.
Edit: I also play solo only pretty much if that matters, and the few friends I've played with have all been higher ranks than me but still I've done better so I haven't been carried or anything like that

Yeah it's kinda strange how because of cycling and learning to walk differently (don't ask it's apprently super rare lol) my lower body has always been the ''strong'' part of my body. Now I'm just scared that if I don't work it as hard as I could I'll end up having a physique that's not really good for me. So lower body is really important all together to me, so I'll definitely do these. Great if they improve the same areas as squats too
Yeah I should do these more, used to do some while trying out calisthenics but after getting back to weights just kinda quit all those :(
Alright I'll look into that aswell, thanks mate :)!
Sadly not an option atm, being a student I don't really have that much money to play around with. Should work into though, since maybe stuff like this could be what i could ask for my birthday lol
I've done few of these didn't know they're even remotely good replacements for squats, lol, thanks!
